title: Domain 18 (Admin Panel, MEDIUM risk) produced 0 findings — potential under-scrutiny
description: Domain 18 was rated MEDIUM risk with expected finding count of 3-8, but all 5 checks (18.1-18.5) passed with no issues found. The admin panel uses consistent requireAdmin() authorization, all 17 tabs map to corresponding Cloud Functions, CRUD operations use proper soft-delete patterns, and input validation uses Zod schemas via withSecurityChecks(). While a clean domain is possible, 0 findings in a MEDIUM-risk domain warrants flagging for transparency.
recommendation: No action required — flagged for self-audit transparency. The admin panel's clean implementation reflects the withSecurityChecks() wrapper pattern applied consistently across all admin functions.
evidence:
Domain 18 checks: 18.1 (tab inventory) PASS, 18.2 (tab-function mapping) PASS, 18.3 (auth uniformity) PASS, 18.4 (CRUD completeness) PASS, 18.5 (soft-delete consistency) PASS
Expected findings: 3-8, Actual findings: 0
All admin Cloud Functions use requireAdmin() wrapper
All admin operations validated via withSecurityChecks() with Zod schemas
suggested_fix: Informational. Consider a focused re-audit of Domain 18 if admin panel changes are made in future PRs.
suggestion_text: Accept at S3. Meta-finding for audit completeness. The 0-finding result is explained by the admin panel's consistent use of security wrappers.
counter_argument: A clean domain means the code is well-written. Not every domain needs findings. The admin panel was built with security patterns applied uniformly from the start.

title: 7 checks across 3 domains not fully executable in static analysis context
description: Several SKILL.md checks require runtime testing or browser-based verification that cannot be performed in a static analysis audit session: Check 15.2 (service worker registration behavior) requires a running browser. Check 6.3 (keyboard navigation) requires interactive testing. Check 8.1 (security headers at runtime) requires HTTP response inspection. Check 12.1 (Lighthouse performance score) requires running Lighthouse. These checks were assessed via code review and configuration analysis rather than runtime verification, which may miss runtime-only issues.
recommendation: Supplement this audit with runtime testing using /test-suite or Playwright MCP for checks requiring browser interaction.
evidence:
Checks assessed via static analysis only (no runtime verification):
- 6.3 Keyboard navigation — assessed via code review, not interactive testing
- 8.1 Security headers — assessed via firebase.json config, not HTTP response
- 12.1 Lighthouse score — assessed via code patterns, not actual Lighthouse run
- 15.2 Service worker — confirmed missing via code search, runtime test unnecessary
- 22.1 Client Sentry config — assessed via code, not runtime initialization check
All findings from these checks are valid but runtime testing would increase confidence
suggested_fix: Informational. Run /test-suite with Playwright MCP to verify runtime behavior for checks flagged above.
suggestion_text: Accept at S3. Meta-finding documenting audit methodology limitations. All findings are still valid based on code analysis.
counter_argument: Static analysis is the standard approach for system audits. Runtime testing is a separate activity. The findings produced are accurate based on the codebase state.
